summary: This bill, the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection-Inspector General Reform Act of 2025, mandates Senate confirmation for the Inspector General of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection (CFPB). It establishes the Inspector General position within the CFPB, outlines requirements for the office, including semiannual hearings before congressional committees, and mandates the CFPB dedicate 2% of its funds to the Inspector General's office. It also specifies a deadline for the President to appoint an Inspector General and sets an effective date tied to Senate confirmation.
